Title: Government intervenes in the Coro jail penitentiary Although ther...
Description: Government intervenes in the Coro jail penitentiaryAlthough there has not yet been an official statement from the authorities, local media reported that at least 20 buses arrived at the prison community, so everything indicates that there will be transfers of prisoners.Sources told El Pitazo that this is Operation Cacique Guaicaipuro, an intervention carried out by the Government in different penitentiary centers in the country, to reestablish order and control within these institutions.

Title: Saab announces 179 -alternative measures- for those arrested in p...
Description: Saab announces 179 -alternative measures- for those arrested in post-election protestsThe Public Prosecutor's Office announced in a statement on Monday that between December 10 and 14, the Judiciary approved 179 revisions of measures for defendants related to the -acts of violence- that broke out after the presidential elections on July 28.In this regard, the agency explained that these releases are added to the 354 measures previously requested and agreed upon, for a total of 533 carried out.

Title: María Corina Machado: -The end of the regime is much closer than ...
Description: María Corina Machado: -The end of the regime is much closer than many imagine-Opposition leader María Corina Machado reiterated her call on Venezuelans to be -alert- to -the signs- and prepared to -do what needs to be done at the right time- to achieve the change that the majority of the country voted for in the presidential elections of July 28.-The end of this regime in Venezuela is much closer than many imagine. We are one step away from that long-awaited change, a step that we still have to take. And that is why I repeat, let us be alert, listen to the signs, prepare our hearts, minds and bodies to do what needs to be done at the right time. There is very little left to do now,- he said in an audio message broadcast on his social networks.

Title: Vente Venezuela denounces forced disappearance of opposition lead...
Description: Vente Venezuela denounces forced disappearance of opposition leader Luis Palocz in ChacaoAccording to the Vente Venezuela human rights commission, Luis Palocz was detained by hooded individuals on Galarraga Avenue and El Samán in the Chacao municipality on Saturday, December 14 at 1:20 p.m.Luis Palocz is the second member of the Command with Venezuela to be the victim of forced disappearance in the same week. The first is Jesús Armas, who was detained under similar conditions on Tuesday, December 10, while leaving a café in Las Mercedes in the Baruta municipality.

Title: 🇻🇪🇦🇷Argentine gendarme accused of -espionage- has reportedly ...
Description: 🇻🇪🇦🇷Argentine gendarme accused of -espionage- has reportedly been transferred to El HelicoideArgentine Security Minister Patricia Bullrich said on Sunday that, according to information received by Venezuelan intelligence agencies, the Argentine gendarme detained in Táchira, Nahuel Agustín Gallo, had been transferred from the border state to El Helicoide, in Caracas.According to the Argentine newspaper El Clarín, the 27-year-old official has been in detention for the first week and has been transferred to a jail for political prisoners.Gallo was on regular leave to visit his partner, Silvia Gómez, and his two-year-old son, who were waiting for him in Caracas.

Title: Situation reported in El Rodeo 1: political prisoners scream for ...
Description: Situation reported in El Rodeo 1: political prisoners scream for helpHuman rights defenders reported that for the second consecutive day, this Saturday, an irregular situation has been registered with political prisoners in the El Rodeo 1 prison.Since Friday, when family visits to this prison were suspended, screams from political prisoners can be heard inside the detention center.Margareth Baduel, sister of political prisoner Josnars Adolfo Baduel, said: -All the relatives demand to know about our relatives, since we hear cries asking for help and shouting the word 'murderer'.-

Description: ⚠️Political prisoner dies in Tocuyito prisonUna Ventana a la Libertad reported that Jesús Rafael Álvarez, one of the political prisoners who are held in the Carabobo Penitentiary Complex (Tocuyito prison), located in the Libertador municipality. Carabobo state, died on Thursday, December 12, 2024 for reasons that are still unknown.-According to unofficial sources, the prisoner who died in the custody of the Venezuelan State was a native of the town of Anaco, Anzoátegui state, eastern Venezuela. Álvarez died yesterday at an undetermined time, for reasons that are currently unknown.-

Title: Four of the seven teenagers detained post-election are released F...
Description: Four of the seven teenagers detained post-election are releasedFour of the seven teenagers held in the Casa de Justicia 431 detention center located in El Cementerio, Caracas, were released after 11:00 PM on Wednesday, December 11.The release of the young men who are still detained will take place between Thursday and Friday, according to other relatives who said they were paying attention because they did not see their children leave the House of Justice that night.

Title: US warns Maduro that his -deadline- is 10E: -If he stays, there w...
Description: US warns Maduro that his -deadline- is 10E: -If he stays, there will be worse things--January 10, 2025 is the deadline for Nicolás Maduro. If he does not recognize the victory of President-elect Edmundo González before that date and does not begin the transition process on January 10, it will become a limit for him,- warned the United States ambassador to Venezuela, Francisco Palmieri, in an interview with El Nacional.Palmieri said that if Maduro steals the elections, the United States will impose new sanctions against his regime.

Title: Maduro's Government formalizes reestablishment of -cooperation- w...
Description: Maduro's Government formalizes reestablishment of -cooperation- with the UN office for human rights.The Maduro government announced on Tuesday that it has officially reestablished cooperation with the UN Human Rights office in Venezuela, after announcing its expulsion at the beginning of the year.In the framework of the International Human Rights Day, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Yván Gil, assured in a statement that they reaffirm -their firm commitment to the promotion, protection and enjoyment of all human rights.--Venezuela calls on the international community to respect the principles contained in this valuable international declaration and to avoid exploiting the noble cause of human rights for political ends, an action that has caused immense harm to humanity,- the statement said.

Title: 🇻🇪 -I will be in Venezuela-: Edmundo González reaffirms that he...
Description: 🇻🇪 -I will be in Venezuela-: Edmundo González reaffirms that he will take office in Caracas and announces that María Corina will be his vice presidentEdmundo González Urrutia is firm. On January 10th he will be in Caracas taking office as the first president. -That is clear: I will be in Venezuela- on that date, the president-elect told the Spanish newspaper El País. His answer to whether he would preside over a government in exile was clear: -No.-Speaking to SEMANA, González had made it clear that he would be in his country on that date and for that purpose. -Yes, my aspiration is to do it in Venezuela. That is the intention we have and in this way we aspire to fulfill the mandate of the popular will that was expressed on July 28 by more than 7 million voters,- he said.Regarding the catastrophic situation in which Venezuela would be received on January 10, González said: -We have a fairly broad government plan, whose guidelines are contained in a text that has been studied, analyzed and reviewed by the best technicians we have. We also have a government plan for the first 100 days. We have priority areas, which in the country are almost all, and which require immediate attention in all sectors. We must recover the economy, the social fabric of the country, the relations with neighboring countries. We are going to form a government team that can implement all the adjustments that are necessary for the recovery of the country. Recovery in the broadest sense: democratic, social, economic.-

Title: -Pollo- Carvajal agrees to cooperate with prosecutors in the Unit...

Title: María Corina Machado will be the executive vice president of Edmu...
Description: María Corina Machado will be the executive vice president of Edmundo González's government-No,- González Urrutia responded bluntly when asked if he plans to be sworn in while currently in exile, adding: -That much is clear: I will be in Venezuela- on that date.-My goal is to take up the office for which I was elected and, from then on, make the decisions that need to be made, including the appointment of the government team.-In light of this, he stressed that opposition leader María Corina Machado will be the executive vice president of the republic.

Title: Saab says they are still reviewing cases of those arrested in pos...
Description: Saab says they are still reviewing cases of those arrested in post-election protestsAttorney General Tarek William Saab confirmed on Thursday afternoon, December 5, that they will continue to review the measures of deprivation of liberty of those arrested during the post-election protests in July. However, he insisted that the possibility of favorable decisions will depend on each case.Saab, interviewed in La Iguana, mentioned the case of the teenager Mariana Gónzalez, who was released from prison and was subject to a review measure after an evaluation made by the Public Prosecutor's Office and the forensic doctor.He stressed that the authorities managed to quell -the violence- in the demonstrations that took place after the elections, following the announcement by the CNE that it had awarded the victory to President Nicolás Maduro. In his opinion, this left the opposition -with nothing.-On the night of Wednesday, December 4, Saab himself announced that the teenager Mariana González - arrested on July 29 during the post-election protests - had been released after requesting a review of the measure.The teenager's case became known a few days ago through a letter sent to her parents. The 16-year-old wrote a letter to her mother in which she revealed the conditions in which she was held and stated that she felt -without strength- and -without the will to live.-In the letter, shared by the human rights account Vente Venezuela, González said that he missed his mother very much and that he was depressed.

Title: María Corina Machado and Delsa Solórzano win the Bush-Thatcher Fr...
Description: María Corina Machado and Delsa Solórzano win the Bush-Thatcher Freedom PrizeThe opposition represented by María Corina Machado and Delsa Solórzano was awarded the Bush-Thatcher Freedom Prize on Thursday evening, December 5, the highest award given by the World Centre-Right Alliance (WCA).The Bush-Thatcher Freedom Prize is named after former US President George H.W. Bush and former British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher. Both were founders of the organisation.

Title: -It's no use to me to be alive if I can't enjoy my son-: a post-e...
Description: -It's no use to me to be alive if I can't enjoy my son-: a post-election political prisoner's letter to his mother from Tocorón-I can't stand this situation any longer. I'm saying goodbye to my entire family. I love them and I'll take care of them all from heaven. It's no use to me to be alive if I can't enjoy my son and my loved ones,- is part of the letter written by Carlos Eduardo Valecillo Ramírez, a post-election political prisoner imprisoned in Tocorón, to his mother, in which he expresses the suffering he has endured since being detained.The Committee for the Freedom of Political Prisoners reported that despite requesting specialized medical attention for Valecillo Ramírez, he continues to not receive it.The detainee has abscesses on his face that have caused deformities and fever, in addition to suffering from anxiety attacks during his detention.

Title: Panamanian government assures that it will not receive migrants d...
Description: Panamanian government assures that it will not receive migrants deported by the US.-In light of international law, we have no obligation to receive deportees of nationalities other than Panamanian. We wish to maintain relations with the United States always within the framework of mutual respect,- the Panamanian Foreign Ministry said on Thursday.The Foreign Ministry's statement comes hours after NBC reported that the future Donald Trump administration would be preparing a list of countries to which it could deport migrants if their countries of origin refused to accept them. According to NBC, that list would include the Turks and Caicos Islands, the Bahamas, Grenada and Panama.The Bahamas government on Thursday rejected US President-elect Donald Trump's proposal to accept migrants from other countries expelled by Washington.

Title: ICC Prosecutor's Office includes in its investigation complaints ...
Description: ICC Prosecutor's Office includes in its investigation complaints for crimes committed after June 28The Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) confirmed that it has included in its investigation into Venezuela the complaints received for alleged crimes against humanity committed after the presidential elections of July 28.In his 2024 management report, prosecutor Karim Khan recalled that after the Appeals Chamber rejected the appeal filed by Nicolás Maduro's regime on March 1, the Prosecutor's Office -quickly- resumed its investigation.-Following the presidential elections held in Venezuela on 28 July 2024, the Office received several communications concerning alleged crimes against humanity, which were assessed in accordance with the Statute. The Office determined that these communications could fall within the scope of its ongoing investigation and is therefore considering them in this context,- said Prosecutor Khan.

Title: After the ICC's pronouncement, Saab denounces a campaign to white...
Description: After the ICC's pronouncement, Saab denounces a campaign to whitewash -terrorists-Attorney General Tarek William Saab said opposition leaders inside and outside the country have launched a campaign to undermine Venezuela and whitewash alleged terrorist groups that the government says have harmed the nation following the July 28 presidential election.He noted that Venezuela is a testing ground for the use of hybrid war strategies aimed at overthrowing legitimate governments, including violence, sanctions and destabilization. He urged the world to open its eyes to the realities being revealed.

Title: Former presidents ask Lula and the Vatican to intercede for Venez...
Description: Former presidents ask Lula and the Vatican to intercede for Venezuelans in the Argentine embassyA group of 29 former presidents of Latin America and the Spanish government asked the president of Brazil, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, and the Vatican on Monday to intercede on behalf of the six Venezuelans who have been refugees since March in the Argentine Embassy in Caracas -guarded by Brazil-, and who are in -conditions of isolation.-Former heads of state members of the Democratic Initiative of Spain and the Americas (IDEA) pointed out that Venezuelans seeking asylum in the diplomatic headquarters, who are immediate collaborators of opposition leader María Corina Machado, are being subjected to -inhuman and degrading treatment- and are prevented from receiving -vital and medical services.-
